column4: I use Ubuntun 10.04 LTS with encrypted home dirs. I had to do some maintenance including swapping of two users' UIDs and GIDs. So I did a deluser on the users and a delgroup on the groups. Then I created the users and groups again with the corrects UIDs/GIDs. Then I chowned all the users' files under /home/$USER and /home/.ecryptfs/$USER. Then I reset password with passwd $USER. But now the users cannot log in -- thus cannot decrypt their files. What do
Your message was cut off at "What do"
ok, I just asked about how I can correct this?
do you have any idea how to solve this?
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/EncryptedPrivateDirectory#Recovering%20Your%20Mount%20Passphrase , also try #ecryptfs on irc.oftc.net
ok.
If at all possible use a CD (Mac's BIOS implementations are buggy when it comes to booting from USB).
Apple's BIOS implementation is buggy. This is a known problem.
ok, but booting from a normal cdrom should work? I was told that this would not work though.
this is the brand new mac book pro. Does it require natty to work? Or will maverick work on it?
Maverick should work (though how well individual pieces of hardware are supported I don't know).
Are you trying to install 32 bit or 64 bit Ubuntu?
preferably 64 bit. Is there any reason to use 32 bit when I have a i7 processor?

This iso should work (when burned to a real CD): http://cdimage.ubuntu.com/ports/releases/10.10/release/ubuntu-10.10-desktop-amd64+mac.iso If you want the torrent link or the alternate or other install CDs look for the '+mac' versions @ http://cdimage.ubuntu.com/ports/releases/10.10/release/ .
so there is a specific mac iso? I could not find this via ubuntu.com.

Only the 64 bit Ubuntu images have EFI support, this ironically *prevents* them from booting properly on macs due to further bugs in Apple's firmware. The +mac is identical to the normal 64 bit image, but with EFI support *removed*.
ok.
how do I find that mac iso from ubuntu.com download section?
It's not linked from the normal downloads page.
why not? Shouldnt it be?
I don't know. It probably should be. If you file a bug report against the Ubuntu website they may add it (especially since they already have mac specific instructions).
